title: UPDATE 1-Linde sees slight gain in earnings on industrial gases
text: March 8, 2018 / 8:12 AM / Updated 16 minutes ago Linde sees slight gain in earnings on industrial gases Reuters Staff 1 Min Read MUNICH (Reuters) - German gases group Linde ( LING.DE ), which is preparing to merge with Praxair ( PX.N ), said 2018 operating profit would rise 5 percent at best as gains in industrial gases are tempered by lower prices for medical gases. Linde Group logo is seen at company building before the annual news conference in Munich, Germany March 9, 2017. REUTERS/Lukas Barth Linde achieved increases in both revenue and operating profit last year after adjusting for currency effects, lifted by a stronger performance from its engineering division. Operating profit rose to 4.21 billion euros ($5.22 billion), in line with market expectations and the group margin increased to 24.6 percent, up from 24.2 percent in 2016. Lindeâ€™s on-site business, which supplies gases to large steel or petrochemicals plants, would benefit from a solid project pipeline this year while the healthcare operations would be burdened by price reductions, the company said. Reporting by Alexander Huebner; Writing by Ludwig Burger; Editing by David Goodman
